title: Modeling a Non-Periodic Context-Exponential Function, Part C

content.description:
Each spring a particular species of fish migrates up a river. “Migrates” refers to moving from one region to another according to the seasons. In 2015 (<math alttext="t equals 0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>), there were <math alttext="4500" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>4500</mn> </math> fish that migrated up the river. In 2021 (<math alttext="t equals 6" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>), there were <math alttext="900" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>900</mn></math> fish that migrated up the river.  

For <math alttext="t greater or equal than 0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the number of fish that migrated up the river can be modeled by the function <math alttext="F" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi></math> given by <math alttext="F open parentheses t close parentheses equals a b to the power of t" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>b</mi><mi>t</mi></msup></math>, where <math alttext="F open parentheses t close parentheses" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is the number of fish that migrated up the river in year <math alttext="t" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi></math>, and <math alttext="t" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi></math> is the number of years since 2015.
content.question:
Part C

Conservation efforts that guarantee an increase in the number of fish that migrate up the river are implemented when the number of fish that migrate up the river drops below <math alttext="400"> <mn>400</mn> </math>. Explain how this information can be used to determine the domain limitations for the model <math alttext="F"><mi>F</mi></math>.

frqParts.text:
Part C

Conservation efforts that guarantee an increase in the number of fish that migrate up the river are implemented when the number of fish that migrate up the river drops below <math alttext="400"> <mn>400</mn> </math>. Explain how this information can be used to determine the domain limitations for the model <math alttext="F"><mi>F</mi></math>.

topic.text: 1.13: Function Model Selection and Assumption Articulation

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
